intro: Neea madeirana, commonly known as the Madeira Neea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the island of Madeira, where it typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Neea madeirana is considered a rare and endemic species.
